review.title: The languages of actions, formal grammars and qualitive modeling of companies
review.abstract: In this paper we discuss methods of using the language of actions, formal languages, and grammars for qualitative conceptual linguistic modeling of companies as technological and human institutions. The main problem following the discussion is the problem to find and describe a language structure for external and internal flow of information of companies. We anticipate that the language structure of external and internal base flows determine the structure of companies. In the structure modeling of an abstract industrial company an internal base flow of information is constructed as certain flow of words composed on the theoretical parts-processes-actions language. The language of procedures is found for an external base flow of information for an insurance company. The formal stochastic grammar for the language of procedures is found by statistical methods and is used in understanding the tendencies of the health care industry. We present the model of human communications as a random walk on the semantic tree

metadata.title: THE LANGUAGES OF ACTIONS, FORMAL GRAMMARS AND QUALITIVE MODELING OF COMPANIES

sections.text: ar Xiv: 160 8.05 694v 1 [cs.A I] 1 9A ug2 016Keywords: organisms, organization, automata, formal languages, formal grammars, action theory, social systems, semantic space, communication model, random walk.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.text: This work is dedicated to the modeling of an organization. First of all, we want to clarify what modeling means. If a person or groups of people use any process or device, he / she or she can know what kind of language this process uses. For example, many people use cars every day. They need to keep a lot of information about cars in mind; the types of sounds and / or vibrations that are normal for the engine and so on. Very often, cars do not know how a car transfers the chemical energy from the fuel into the mechanical movement of the vehicle in order to get the vehicle going. All of these attributes could be considered as the language with which the car speaks to you. More often than it is likely that a driver does not know how a car translates the mechanical movement of the vehicle into the language, but they definitely know something about the language of the cars. So, any process or device communicates with us and uses a language. Sometimes, this language is very primitive, but the process speaks to us through a very complex language.

sections.heading: A. TOOLS FORMAL GRAMMAR, FINITE-STATEMACHINE (AUTOMATA)
sections.text: Formal languages are based on formal grammar. Formal grammar G is represented by the quadruplets x N, T, P, S y, where S is the root or start symbol, T is the set of terminal symbols, N is the set of non-terminal symbols, and P is the set of grammar rules, substitutions, or productions. Alphabet V is the union of T and N, where in general the alphabet is a set of arbitrary symbols. The root symbol belongs to the alphabet V. Let's use the symbols for all words generated by the alphabet.

What do we mean by fragments? We can easily explain the above sequence. The waiter gets a service unit (U1), he / she dresses the mask of a warm welcome (B1) and tries to find a good place for the customers to sit (F). The waiter then brings additional chairs if necessary (H), controls how the customer (customer) feels and brings them the menu (B), and so on. We can see a lot of embedded Os and Zs. It reflects that O (check result of the action) and Z (constantly track customers). Os and Zs are not so different: in case O, the waiter needs to communicate personally with the customers.

sections.text: MANTIC TREE.This part contains information about the mathematical stochastic model of conversation and conflict. This model was realized as a program and the author gets the same numerical results. Since the complete description of the model is quite long, we present here only a toy version of the model.

sections.heading: A. COMMON INTERESTS AND THREE LEVELS OF COMMUNICATION
sections.text: We must first define what common interests mean in a particular model. If we have two words a and b and there is a common prefix c, then a = c * and b = c *, where symbol * means the same set of letters (for any alphabet). If person one contains a preferred sentence a and not b and the second person contains a preferred sentence b and not a, we can say that person a has common interests at level c or c interests. We will distinguish three levels of communication: level one or the general level, level two or genuine common interests when people are emotionally involved in the same business, and level three or private, heart-to-heart communication. Second level communication generates (sometimes) deep positive or negative relationships. These types of communication are the basis for the emergence of new groups and the crash of old groups. The third level of communication leads to love affairs and / or the emergence or destruction of families. For this type of communication partners, we first use body language, the language of the language of gaze and touch.

(We no longer calculate Tables A and B because it is not important for our understanding.) So let's say we have the hierarchy system of Tables A and B. The number of pairs in the tables must correspond to the number of levels. The algorithm is a loop and each step must begin from the first level. After Stop, the algorithm prints a word and goes back to the first level. At level N, a special program randomly receives a substitution rule from the first column of Table A (with probability from the right part of Table A). If the rule then does not have the special symbol *, the algorithm prints a word and goes to the first level. If the symbol * is present, the algorithm prints a part of the table A (with probability from the right part of the table B).

The main problem following the discussion is the problem to find and describe a language structure for external and internal flow of information of companies. We anticipate that the language structure of external and internal base flows determine the structure of companies. In the structure modeling of an abstract industrial company an internal base flow of information is constructed as certain flow of words composed on the theoretical parts-processes-actions language. The language of procedures is found for an external base flow of information for an insurance company. The formal stochastic grammar for the language of procedures is found by statistical methods and is used in understanding the tendencies of the health care industry.We present the model of human communications as a random walk on the semantic tree.
